intro: Pseudocyclosorus lushanensis, commonly known as the Lushan spore moss, is a rare and specialized member of the hornworts, characterized by its unique morphology and reproductive structures. It is native to China, specifically the Lushan region, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a thalloid structure with a dorsiventral differentiation, typical of many hornworts, and produces small, capsule-like sporophytes. Its spores are dispersed by wind, contributing to its limited distribution. Due to its restricted habitat and sensitivity to environmental changes, Pseudocyclosorus lushanensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
